title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when choosing SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText produces a beep when selecting SWT.MULTI. This behavior does not seem intended.
OB: When selecting SWT.MULTI in the ControlExampleText, an unexpected action occurs. However, the observed behavior is not specified in the bug report.
EB: When selecting SWT.MULTI in the ControlExampleText, a Windows 'ding' sound is heard, indicating an error or incorrect action.
SR:
To reproduce the issue using Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K (SWT Example):
1. Open the SWT example 'ControlExample'
2. Go to the 'Text' tab
3. Click on the 'Styles' button
4. Select 'SWT.SINGLE'
5. Click on the 'Styles' button again
6. Select 'SWT.MULTI'
The beep sound should be heard when performing step 6.
